TEI.2.document_title: William Trimble to Stephen F. Austin, 06-26-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 842

div1.p: I have formed a flew days acquaintance with Green Dewit beside the Recommendation of those of my neighbours who have been long acquainted with him and I am indused as a friend to his character to say that he is a gentleman in whome every confidence can be placed— and any favour you can do him will be kindly Received and remembered by your friend and humble svt
Judge of the 3rd Judicial Circuit for the Territory of Arkansas—
Stephen F Austin and any person to whome it my be handed—
